column5: ~~~~Well after finally getting the front deck off the boat got a good look at the crack, and decided to get it welded. Asking if anyone in my area knows a good Aluminum welder, or shop, Too old to do it myself
Nelson welding. Located on Finley. Ive used him for some steel welds. Not sure if he does it but im sure he knows someone that does.
Thanks Moxie, just up the street from me

I know an amazing aluminum welding guy, but he is north of port hope, near garden hill. All he does is aluminum, and he has all the tools to do it right. If you want to go there, send me a PM and i will give you his contact.  My bet is he will suggest not welding it, but fabricate a piece to make a patch, seal, and rivet it on over the crack.  He has done some pretty amazing things for me with aluminum. Jobs other aluminum guys said couldnt be done.  S.
elite welding, they do aluminum  i also have a customer at work who does aluminum welding, i can get his info next time hes in
HA.. I thought you were talking about me for a minute Shayne!!
~~~Thanks guys wish I had asked earlier, found a guy in Bowmanville, taking the boat there this Sat. and pick it up Sunday.
HA.. I thought you were talking about me for a minute Shayne!! I thought so too!  HAHAHA

~~~~Well as I said took my boat over to Bowmanville to a guy named Garrnett dropped it off Sat morning and he calls back at 5:30 boats ready, so I went and got her, he did a fantastic job of clearing the old gunk I had on there and welded it up, and on the inside he puts some heavy tack welds, his quote for the job was $200, we agreed it was worth $250. Highly recommend him.
